tweets.text:
We've installed specially designed large steel beams into the river channel as a temporary barrier between the Ouse & Foss whilst the permanent gate is replaced.

These will provide #flood protection for nearby #York properties during the work even whilst river levels are high. https://t.co/SHPQBfgxNy

Would you know what to do if a flood was forecast in your area? 

Now‚Äôs the best time to get planning to avoid damage to your property and treasured possessions - or even save a life. 

Know what to do in a flood: https://t.co/3jQgAKQj9B https://t.co/ZV8jKAZPR9

We are excited to announce that funding has been secured for the BEACH Esk project. 

This project will create new saltmarsh habitat in the Esk estuary and reduce pollution in the estuary and it‚Äôs tributaries.

#EnvironmentProgramme #riverrestoration #Whitby https://t.co/hWmQTgUXKj

What do you think of this? https://t.co/vDHUGfFSLa

@CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets https://t.co/2xpuP1Q6gt

tweets.text: @CelticReptile @janeyh41 @MarkAvery @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets Well they are a native European species. I am referring to the non-native breed of terrapins back in the day and caused an amazing amount of devastation. EPTs I'm not sure were ever native in the UK. All populations in Europe are declining.

@jezsquires @janeyh41 @MarkAvery @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets Not European pond turtles. Different prey preferences and population structure.

tweets.text: @janeyh41 @MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets Terrapins would destroy a native pond or stream as they have no natural predators in UK and wiped out many localised populations of native freshwater snails, invertebrates, crayfish and freshwater mussels. So yes. They destroy environments.

tweets.text: @jezsquires @MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets Would turtles destroy environments too?

Our project team in Slough have successfully opened up the Salt Hill stream and used other #NaturalFloodManagement techniques to create flood-busting wetlands - in partnership with @thameswater, @EnvAgency and @SloughCouncil 

(3/4) https://t.co/FaleJPq3yZ

@kernowbeaver @MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets For those particular feasibility studies, constraints in supply of animals are such that working the studies up isn't delaying anything. Frankly I think beavers should be released into many river systems now, without further study or delay.

urls.title: DWT time and money being wasted trying to catch dumped terrapins at Bystock
urls.description: Dumped pet terrapins have been feasting on the wildlife which an Exmouth beauty spot is known for, according to Devon Wildlife Trust...

tweets.text: @MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets I find this slightly worrying. Our local Nature reserve "Bystock pools" has had to catch several abandoned turtles as they bred well and were eating all the fish stocks and dragonfly larvae.

urls.title: Anglian Water has breached permit covering amount of treated sewage released into River Cam since 2015
urls.description: Environment Agency has sent warning letters over discharge from Cambridge Water Water Treatment Plant.

tweets.text:
The Cambridge Water Treatment Plant has been exceeding its permit limiting the amount of treated sewage that can be released in the River Cam since 2015, the Environment Agency told me 
https://t.co/n5pGBEVNjF

tweets.text: Community-based observation from villages at Ponoy, Russia, indicates massive expansion of introduced pink salmon from 2006. Local fishers say they now appear yearly. Must we expect a change from odd-year to annual invasions in our rivers too?https://t.co/EFo9yOgXMM üì∑DTengs https://t.co/R6qkIjUnu4

tweets.text: @BenGoldsmith @MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets The system we have forged for nature recovery in Britain is wheezing along like an old robin reliant it‚Äôs inadequate and profoundly pointless. These kids and others like them should be given an immediate role with adequate information and implored to assist.

@SteveCJjones @MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets I think we can choose to be super cautious and 'led by the science' or we can choose life. This is not described as an emergency for nothing.

@kernowbeaver @MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets Don't worry Chris, I've been worn down by two decades of species action planning and flood management consenting - much to no good effect! But I'm also working up a couple of species reintroduction feasibility studies and so can see their value, sort of.
¬£20K match funding from @EnvAgencySE will enable us to install tide pools as part of the @SouthseaCS to provide a habitat for marine organisms at risk from rising sea levels. https://t.co/g1rZzNH8vG

Provided they‚Äôre dealing with natives and do things professionally, I think they‚Äôre outstanding

So the @EnvAgency has published its annual report, 5 months late.

Apparently they "Have achieved a huge amount over the last year", obviously including, not a single river in England reaches 'Good' overall environmental health.

Spent ¬£1.431 billion and employed 10,229 staff. https://t.co/0aEhhtaw8p

This was the first of our planned re-stockings for the riverüêü #Norfolk #Fish https://t.co/cwG3jr8RTc

@janeyh41 @MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets I think you are referring to North American terrapins, popularised by the TMNT cartoons and films in the 90s. Parents bought them as pets for kids and when they grew to the size of a plate chucked them out and they destroyed local lakes/ponds indigenous species.
